attributes.action: Recognise that the NHS is fragmented into different services by changing its name
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We have what we are led to believe is a "National" Health Service in the United Kingdom but in reality the services change depending on whether you live in England, Wales or Scotland.

For example, A Welsh person does not have the right to "choose and book" an operation in an English hospital.  Another example is that all Scotish patients receive their prescriptions free.

The reality is that we have a Welsh Heath Service, a Scottish Health Service and an English Health Service.  Each has separate budgets, management and levels of service.

We should no longer live under the illusion that the UK has a national level of healthcare provision and now is the time for the Government to recognise this by introducing the new names.
